name: Évaluer les CV par rapport aux JD avec Google Drive, Google Sheets et GPT-4o
description:
## Description
Comparez automatiquement les CV des candidats aux descriptions de poste (PDF) depuis Google Drive, générez un score d'adéquation de 0 à 100 avec analyse des écarts, et mettez à jour Google Sheets—propulsé par Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini). Screening rapide et cohérent avec des rapports sauvegardés dans Drive. 📈📄

## Ce que fait ce modèle
- Récupère les descriptions de poste et les CV (PDF) depuis Google Drive. 📥
- Extrait du texte propre des deux PDF pour analyse. 🧼
- Génère une évaluation par IA (score, écarts indispensables, bonus souhaitables, résumé). 🤝
- Analyse la sortie de l'IA en JSON structuré. 🧩
- Fournit un rapport texte sauvegardé dans Drive et met à jour une feuille Google. 🗂️

## Avantages clés
- Gagnez du temps avec un scoring automatisé et cohérent. ⏱️
- Analyse claire des écarts pour des décisions rapides. 🔍
- Rapports prêts pour audit stockés dans Drive. 🧾
- Suivi centralisé dans Google Sheets. 📊
- Fonctionnement sans code après la configuration initiale. 🧑‍💻

## Caractéristiques
- Recherche et téléchargement de Google Drive pour les JD et les CV. 📂
- Extraction PDF-vers-texte pour un parsing fiable. 📝
- Comparaison et scoring par Azure OpenAI (GPT-4o-mini). 🤖
- Parsing JSON robuste et gestion des erreurs. 🛡️
- Création automatique de rapports dans Drive. 💾
- Ajouter ou mettre à jour les données des candidats dans Google Sheets. 📑

## Exigences
- Instance n8n (cloud ou auto-hébergée).
- Identifiants Google Drive dans n8n avec accès aux dossiers JD et CV (par exemple, “magasin JD”, “magasin_CV”).
- Accès à Azure OpenAI avec un modèle GPT-4o-mini déployé et des identifiants dans n8n.
- Identifiants Google Sheets dans n8n pour ajouter ou mettre à jour les lignes des candidats.
- PDFs pour les descriptions de poste et les CV stockés dans les dossiers Drive désignés.

## Public cible
- Équipes d'acquisition de talents et opérations RH. 🧠
- Recruteurs (internes et agences). 🧑‍💼
- Responsables de recrutement cherchant une présélection cohérente. 🧭
- Équipes opérationnelles standardisant les dossiers d'évaluation des candidats. 🗃️

## Instructions de configuration étape par étape
- Connectez Google Drive et Google Sheets dans les identifiants n8n et vérifiez l'accès aux dossiers. 🔑
- Ajoutez les identifiants Azure OpenAI et sélectionnez GPT-4o-mini dans le nœud IA. 🧠
- Importez le flux de travail et assignez des identifiants à tous les nœuds (Drive, IA, Sheets). 📦
- Définissez les références de dossier pour les JD (“magasin JD”) et les CV (“magasin_CV”). 📁
- Exécutez une fois pour valider l'extraction, le scoring, la création de rapports et les mises à jour de feuilles. ✅

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI resume evaluator.
Your task is to compare a candidate’s resume against a provided job description and return a structured JSON evaluation.
Follow these rules:

Evaluate alignment between the job description (JD) and the resume.

Assign a score (0–100) where:

90–100 = Excellent fit

70–89 = Good fit with some gaps

50–69 = Moderate fit with significant gaps

Below 50 = Poor fit

Identify must_have_gaps → missing critical skills, experience, or qualifications explicitly required in the JD.

Identify nice_to_have_bonus → additional desirable skills, certifications, or achievements mentioned in the JD but not mandatory.

Provide a summary (3–5 sentences) describing the overall fit and candidate potential.

Always return output in the following JSON format (no extra text, no markdown):

parameters.name: ={{ $('Search Resume').item.json.name }}_result-summary

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## JD Match Score Workflow
**Purpose:** Compares candidate resumes against job descriptions and calculates compatibility scores.

**Node Descriptions:**

**Manual Trigger**
Initiates the job description matching process
Used for resume evaluation against specific roles

**Search JD (Google Drive)**
Searches for job description files in designated Google Drive folder
Retrieves JD documents for comparison

**Download File (JD)**
Downloads job description PDF files from Google Drive
Prepares files for content extraction

**Extract from File (JD)**
Extracts text content from job description PDFs
Converts documents to readable text format

**Search Resume (Google Drive)**
Locates candidate resume files in resume storage folder
Retrieves resume documents for analysis

**Download File (Resume)**
Downloads candidate resume PDF files
Prepares resume files for processing

**Extract from File (Resume)**
Extracts text content from resume PDFs
Converts resume documents to analyzable text

**AI Agent**
Compares job description against candidate resume using Azure OpenAI
Evaluates alignment and compatibility (0-100 score)
Identifies must-have gaps and nice-to-have bonuses
Generates detailed summary of candidate fit

**Code Node**
Parses AI evaluation results into structured JSON
Handles JSON parsing and error management
Cleans evaluation output for database storage

**Create File from Text**
Generates evaluation summary reports
Saves detailed results as text files in Google Drive
Creates audit trail of evaluations

**Append or Update Row in Sheet**
Updates candidate database with JD match scores
Stores evaluation summaries and scores
Maintains comprehensive candidate profiles

options.systemMessage:
You are an AI resume evaluator.
Your task is to compare a candidate's resume against a provided job description and return a structured JSON evaluation.
Follow these rules:

Evaluate alignment between the job description (JD) and the resume.

Assign a score (0–100) where:

90–100 = Excellent fit

70–89 = Good fit with some gaps

50–69 = Moderate fit with significant gaps

Below 50 = Poor fit

Identify must_have_gaps → missing critical skills, experience, or qualifications explicitly required in the JD.

Identify nice_to_have_bonus → additional desirable skills, certifications, or achievements mentioned in the JD but not mandatory.

Provide a summary (3–5 sentences) describing the overall fit and candidate potential.

Always return output in the following JSON format (no extra text, no markdown):

parameters.name: ={{ $('Find Candidate Resumes in Drive').item.json.name }}_result-summary

parameters.content:
## 🚀 START PROCESS

**Start Resume Evaluation Process**

• **Purpose**: Manually trigger the entire resume evaluation workflow
• **Action**: Click to begin comparing candidate resumes against job descriptions
• **Output**: Initiates the sequential processing of all workflow steps
• **Best Practice**: Use this when you have new resumes to evaluate or want to re-run evaluations

## 📁 JOB DESCRIPTION SEARCH

**Find Job Descriptions in Drive**

• **Purpose**: Locates all job description files stored in the designated Google Drive folder
• **Folder**: Searches in 'JD store' folder
• **File Types**: Looks for PDF job description documents
• **Output**: Returns list of available JD files with their IDs and metadata
• **Note**: Ensure JD files are properly uploaded to the correct folder

## 📥 DOWNLOAD JD FILE

**Download Job Description PDF**

• **Purpose**: Downloads the selected job description PDF file from Google Drive
• **Input**: File ID from the search results
• **Process**: Retrieves the actual PDF file content for processing
• **Output**: Binary PDF data ready for text extraction
• **Credentials**: Uses Google Drive OAuth2 API connection

## 📄 EXTRACT JD TEXT

**Extract JD Text Content**

• **Purpose**: Converts PDF job description into readable text format
• **Input**: Binary PDF data from downloaded file
• **Process**: Uses PDF parsing to extract all text content
• **Output**: Plain text version of the job description
• **Quality**: Maintains formatting and structure of original document

## 🔍 RESUME SEARCH

**Find Candidate Resumes in Drive**

• **Purpose**: Searches for candidate resume files in the resume storage folder
• **Folder**: Looks in 'Resume_store' folder
• **File Types**: Identifies PDF resume documents
• **Process**: Returns all available resume files for batch processing
• **Organization**: Maintains separate folders for JDs and resumes

## 📥 DOWNLOAD RESUME

**Download Candidate Resume PDF**

• **Purpose**: Downloads individual candidate resume PDF files
• **Input**: Resume file ID from search results
• **Process**: Retrieves PDF file content for text extraction
• **Output**: Binary resume data ready for processing
• **Batch Processing**: Handles multiple resumes sequentially

## 📄 EXTRACT RESUME TEXT

**Extract Resume Text Content**

• **Purpose**: Converts PDF resume into analyzable text format
• **Input**: Binary PDF resume data
• **Process**: Parses PDF to extract all textual information
• **Output**: Clean text version of candidate resume
• **Quality**: Preserves resume structure and content integrity

## 🤖 AI EVALUATION ENGINE

**AI Resume Evaluator Agent**

• **Purpose**: Intelligently compares resume against job description using AI
• **Scoring System**: 
  - 90-100: Excellent fit
  - 70-89: Good fit with minor gaps
  - 50-69: Moderate fit with gaps
  - Below 50: Poor fit
• **Analysis**: Identifies must-have gaps and nice-to-have bonuses
• **Output**: Structured JSON evaluation with detailed summary

## ⚙️ AI MODEL CONFIG

**Azure OpenAI GPT-4 Model**

• **Model**: GPT-4o-mini for cost-effective evaluation
• **Purpose**: Powers the AI evaluation agent
• **Capabilities**: Natural language understanding and structured output
• **Connection**: Links to Azure OpenAI service
• **Performance**: Optimized for resume analysis tasks

## 🔧 JSON PARSER

**Parse AI Response to JSON**

• **Purpose**: Converts AI text output into structured JSON format
• **Process**: Removes markdown formatting and parses JSON
• **Error Handling**: Manages parsing failures gracefully
• **Output**: Clean JSON object with score, gaps, bonuses, and summary
• **Data Quality**: Ensures consistent data structure for downstream processing

## 📊 SAVE REPORT

**Save Evaluation Report to Drive**

• **Purpose**: Creates detailed evaluation report as text file
• **Content**: Includes score, gaps, bonuses, and summary
• **Naming**: Uses candidate name + '_result-summary' format
• **Storage**: Saves to Resume_store folder for organization
• **Audit Trail**: Maintains permanent record of all evaluations

## 📈 DATABASE UPDATE

**Update Candidate Database**

• **Purpose**: Updates Google Sheets database with evaluation results
• **Data**: Stores candidate score and summary
• **Matching**: Uses candidate name to update existing records
• **Tracking**: Maintains comprehensive candidate evaluation history
• **Integration**: Enables easy data analysis and reporting

## 📋 JD MATCH SCORE WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**🎯 Purpose:** Automated system to evaluate candidate resumes against job descriptions and generate compatibility scores

**🔄 Workflow Steps:**
1. **Search & Download**: Locate JD and resume files from Google Drive
2. **Extract Content**: Convert PDF documents to text format
3. **AI Analysis**: Use GPT-4 to compare and score candidate fit
4. **Process Results**: Parse AI output and structure data
5. **Store Results**: Save reports and update candidate database

**📊 Scoring System:**
• 90-100: Excellent match (hire immediately)
• 70-89: Good fit with minor training needed
• 50-69: Moderate fit requiring skill development
• Below 50: Poor fit for this role

**💡 Benefits:**
• Objective, consistent evaluation process
• Detailed gap analysis for each candidate
• Automated report generation and storage
• Comprehensive candidate database tracking

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.
